purgeRecordsOutsideRange(range)

Purges records outside a given x range. Changes removal method based on number of records to remove: for large purge, reset data and rebuild array. for small purge, removes points and emits updates.

Parameters:
Name Type Description

setSearchParam()

Utility functions for getting and setting Open MCT search parameters and navigated object path. Open MCT encodes application state into the "hash" of the url, making it awkward to use standard browser API such as URL for modifying state in the URL. This wraps native API with some utility functions that operate only on the hash section of the URL.

Source:
  • utils/openmctLocation.js, line 32

Type Definitions

ClockOffsets

Clock offsets are used to calculate temporal bounds when the system is ticking on a clock source.

Type:
  • object
Properties:
Name Type Description
start number

A time span relative to the current value of the ticking clock, from which start bounds will be calculated. This value must be < 0. When a clock is active, bounds will be calculated automatically based on the value provided by the clock, and the defined clock offsets.
end number

A time span relative to the current value of the ticking clock, from which end bounds will be calculated. This value must be >= 0.
Source:
  • api/time/TimeAPI.js, line 402

ConvertedTelemetryObject

Telemetry data objects are converted from TelemetrySeries. Metadata is used to populate the returned object with attributes corresponding to the keys of domains and ranges. The attribute values are those returned by calls to TelemetrySeries.getDomainValue() and TelemetrySeries.getRangeValue().

Type:
  • object
Source:
  • adapter/runs/LegacyTelemetryProvider.js, line 89

NotificationModel

A representation of a banner notification. Banner notifications are used to inform users of events in a non-intrusive way. As much as possible, notifications share a model with blocking dialogs so that the same information can be provided in a dialog and then minimized to a banner notification if needed, or vice-versa.

Type:
  • object
Properties:
Name Type Attributes Description
message string

The message to be displayed by the notification
progress number | 'unknown' <optional>

The progres of some ongoing task. Should be a number between 0 and 100, or with the string literal 'unknown'.
progressText string <optional>

A message conveying progress of some ongoing task.
Source:
  • api/notifications/NotificationAPI.js, line 36
See:
  • DialogModel

options

A description of option properties that can be passed into the overlay

Properties:
Name Type Description
element object

DOMElement that is to be inserted/shown on the overlay
size string

prefered size of the overlay (large, small, fit)
buttons array

optional button objects with label and callback properties
onDestroy function

callback to be called when overlay is destroyed
dismissable boolean

allow user to dismiss overlay by using esc, and clicking away from overlay. Unless set to false, all overlays will be dismissable by default.
Source:
  • api/overlays/OverlayAPI.js, line 58

options

Displays a blocking (modal) dialog. This dialog can be used for displaying messages that require the user's immediate attention.

Properties:
Name Type Description
title string

the title to use for the dialog
iconClass string

class to apply to icon that is shown on dialog
message string

text that indicates a current message,
buttons Array.<buttons>

a list of buttons with title and callback properties that will be added to the dialog.
Source:
  • api/overlays/OverlayAPI.js, line 76

Properties:
Name Type Description

progressText string

buttons Array.<buttons>

a list of buttons with title and callback properties that will be added to the dialog.

Source:
  • plugins/localTimeSystem/LocalTimeFormat.js, line 37

TimeSystem

A TimeSystem provides meaning to the values returned by the TimeAPI. Open MCT supports multiple different types of time values, although all are intrinsically represented by numbers, the meaning of those numbers can differ depending on context.

A default time system is provided by Open MCT in the form of the UTCTimeSystem, which represents integer values as ms in the Unix epoch. An example of another time system might be "sols" for a Martian mission. TimeSystems do not address the issue of converting between time systems.

Type:
  • object
Properties:
Name Type Attributes Description
key string

A unique identifier
name string

A human-readable descriptor
cssClass string <optional>

Specify a css class defining an icon for this time system. This will be visible next to the time system in the menu in the Time Conductor
timeFormat string

The key of a format to use when displaying discrete timestamps from this time system
durationFormat string <optional>

The key of a format to use when displaying a duration or relative span of time in this time system.
Source:
  • api/time/TimeAPI.js, line 68
